intro: Phalangites ramosus, commonly known as the hairy phalangite, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its foliage is often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental qualities and ability to attract pollinators.
